nodes.name: CHEM 1A
nodes.title: General Chemistry
nodes.details: High school chemistry recommended

nodes.name: CHEM 1AD
nodes.title: General Chemistry (Digital)
nodes.details: High school chemistry recommended

nodes.name: CHEM 1AL
nodes.title: General Chemistry Laboratory
nodes.details: 1A (may be taken concurrently)

nodes.name: CHEM 1B
nodes.title: General Chemistry
nodes.details: Chemistry 1A and Chemistry 1AL or equivalent, or a score of 3, 4, or 5 on the Chemistry AP test

nodes.name: CHEM 3A
nodes.title: Chemical Structure and Reactivity
nodes.details: 1A with a grade of C- or higher, or a score of 4 or 5 on the Chemistry AP test

nodes.name: CHEM 3AL
nodes.title: Organic Chemistry Laboratory
nodes.details: 1A and 1AL or equivalent with a grade of C- or higher, or a score of 4 or 5 on Chemistry AP test; 3A (may be taken concurrently)

nodes.name: CHEM 3B
nodes.title: Chemical Structure and Reactivity
nodes.details: 3A with a grade of C- or higher

nodes.name: CHEM 3BL
nodes.title: Organic Chemistry Laboratory
nodes.details: 3AL; 3B (may be taken concurrently)

nodes.name: CHEM 4A
nodes.title: General Chemistry and Quantitative Analysis
nodes.details: High school chemistry; calculus (may be taken concurrently); high school physics is recommended

nodes.name: CHEM 4B
nodes.title: General Chemistry and Quantitative Analysis
nodes.details: High school chemistry; calculus (may be taken concurrently); high school physics is recommended

nodes.name: CHEM 12A
nodes.title: Organic Chemistry
nodes.details: 12A: 1B or 4B with grade of C- or higher; 12B: 12A with grade of C- or higher. For students majoring in chemistry or a closely related field such as chemical engineering or molecular and cell biology

nodes.name: CHEM 12B
nodes.title: Organic Chemistry
nodes.details: 12A: 1B or 4B with grade of C- or higher. 12B: 12A with grade of C- or higher. For students majoring in chemistry or a closely related field such as chemical engineering or molecular and cell biology

nodes.name: CHEM 15
nodes.title: Analytical and Bioanalytical Chemistry
nodes.details: 1A and 1AL or equivalent

nodes.name: CHEM 103
nodes.title: Inorganic Chemistry in Living Systems
nodes.details: Chemistry 3A or 112A. Chemistry majors can only count 2 of the 3 towards their Allied Subject requirement

nodes.name: CHEM 104A
nodes.title: Advanced Inorganic Chemistry
nodes.details: 1B, 4B, or 3A; 104A is prerequisite to 104B

nodes.name: CHEM 104B
nodes.title: Advanced Inorganic Chemistry
nodes.details: 104A or consent of instructor. Chemical Biology majors can only count 2 of the 3 towards their Allied Subject requirement for 104B after taking 103

nodes.name: CHEM 105
nodes.title: Instrumental Methods in Analytical Chemistry
nodes.details: 4B; or 1B and 15; or 1B and a UC GPA of 3.3 or higher

nodes.name: CHEM 108
nodes.title: Inorganic Synthesis and Reactions
nodes.details: 4B or 15; 104B with grade of C- or higher, or 103

nodes.name: CHEM C110L
nodes.title: General Biochemistry and Molecular Biology Laboratory
nodes.details: MCB 110 (may be taken concurrently)

nodes.name: CHEM 113
nodes.title: Advanced Mechanistic Organic Chemistry
nodes.details: 3B or 112B with a minimum grade of B- or consent of instructor

nodes.name: CHEM 114
nodes.title: Advanced Synthetic Organic Chemistry
nodes.details: 3B or 112B with a minimum grade of B- or consent of instructor

nodes.name: CHEM 115
nodes.title: Organic Chemistry--Advanced Laboratory Methods
nodes.details: 112B with a grade of C- or higher

nodes.name: CHEM 120A
nodes.title: Physical Chemistry
nodes.details: 4B or equivalent; Physics 7B or 8B; Mathematics 53; Mathematics 54 or consent of instructor

nodes.name: CHEM 120B
nodes.title: Physical Chemistry
nodes.details: 4B or equivalent; Mathematics 53; Mathematics 54 (may be taken concurrently); Physics 7B or 8B

nodes.name: CHEM 130B
nodes.title: Biophysical Chemistry
nodes.details: Chemistry C130 or Molecular and Cell Biology C100A, or consent of instructor. Chemistry and Chemical Biology majors can only count 2 of the 3 towards their Allied Subject requirement

nodes.name: CHEM C130
nodes.title: Biophysical Chemistry: Physical Principles and the Molecules of Life
nodes.details: Chemistry 3A or 112A, Mathematics 1A, Biology 1A and 1AL; Chemistry 3B or 112B recommended

nodes.name: CHEM 135
nodes.title: Chemical Biology
nodes.details: 3B or 112B; Biology 1A; or consent of instructor

nodes.name: CHEM 143
nodes.title: Nuclear Chemistry
nodes.details: Physics 7B or equivalent

nodes.name: CHEM 146
nodes.title: Radiochemical Methods in Nuclear Technology and Forensics
nodes.details: 4B or 15; 143 is recommended

nodes.name: CHEM C150
nodes.title: Introduction to Materials Chemistry
nodes.details: 104A; 104B is recommended

nodes.name: CHEM C170L
nodes.title: Biochemical Engineering Laboratory
nodes.details: Chemical Engineering 170A (may be taken concurrently) or consent of instructor

nodes.name: CHEM C182
nodes.title: Atmospheric Chemistry and Physics Laboratory
nodes.details: Earth and Planetary Science 50 and 102 with grades of C- or higher (one of which may be taken concurrently) or two of the following: Chemistry 120A, 120B, C130, or 130B with grades of C- or higher (one of which may be taken concurrently)

nodes.name: EPS 102
nodes.title: History and Evolution of Planet Earth

nodes.name: MCB C100A
nodes.title: Biophysical Chemistry: Physical Principles and the Molecules of Life

nodes.name: MCB 110
nodes.title: Molecular Biology: Macromolecular Synthesis and Cellular Function
